comment._content: www.ubuyvacations.com/Railroad/20thCentury1.html#Wreck and "The accident to the New York Central's Twentieth Century Limited at Hyde Park on March 13, 1912, was due to an irregularity in super-elevation of the outer rail, or what is more commonly known as a low spot in the track, and not to a broken rail, as was generally supposed, according to the finding of the Public Service Commission of the Second District, after a most thorough investigation. comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called New York Central Railroad, and we'd love to have your photo -and membership- added to the group.
